title: Provide a way to use AWS Secrets Manager to get the sensitive configurations, like APIKEY and Database connection string
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I am trying to run BaGet in a Kubernetes cluster (AWS EKS to be precise). I run into the problem of providing the APIKEY and Database Connection String in  a secure way. Since BaGet is running inside a container, I would need to provide environment variables; however putting the database password and api key in plaintext in the Kubernetes configmap is a terrible idea.
Other environments might also have security concerns with exposing secrets in environment variables.

### Describe the solution you'd like
I would like to provide in the environment variables and/or configuration files only the path to the AWS Secrets Manager ressource, like `DB_ConnectionString_From_Aws_Secrets = /prod/database/connectionstring` . During the Startup of the program, it would check if this key is set, and if so make an AWS client call to retrieve the secret value. Similar for API key.
I like very much the modular approach in BaGet, and I'm sure Azure and GCP have similar services that could be leveraged. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I considered using Kubernetes secrets. But the problem is just moved elsewhere: where do I update the Kubernetes secret ? For instance AWS has all the mechanisms to automatically rotate the secrets, log and audit how is accessing the secrets and when. Trying to keep this in sync within Kubernetes can be a nightmare.  Ref : https://github.com/aws/containers-roadmap/issues/168

### Additional context
From what I've seen, the main things that need to be kept secret would be:
- API key
- Database connection string (containing both username and password)
In case of secret rotation, the BaGet server needs to either reload them automatically (difficult, need to poll), or restart entirely (preferred, but how to know when to restart?). That's a bit beyond what this issue is about, since as a workaround I can ask the secret rotation lambda to restart the deployment.

title: allow to filter search result by regular expression
body:
Hi,

thanks for your great nuget alternative.

We have several instances of baget for different purposes:

  a) internal packages
  b) caching packages from nuget.org

We would like to prevent that the cache server gives use packages with a certain name schema to avoid clashes with internal packages. Lets say we use *xyz* as prefix for packages e.g. xyz.xmlparser and someone uploads another package with the same name to nuget.org, we must be sure we get always our package.
Another use-case would be to block malicious packages.

The current behavior does not change unless the regular expression has been configured.

Summary:
 * Add a new option to blacklist packages by regular expression

--
Best regards,

David

title: Move to System.Text.Json
body: Replaces Newtonsoft.Json with System.Text.Json. This will simplifies the route-to-code migration (see https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/pull/558).

title: Move to System.Text.Json and route-to-code
body:
⚠TODO:
1. Convert remaining controllers to route-to-code
1. Polish route-to-code handlers

title: Add integration tests
body:
Add integration tests on the BaGet application to ensure BaGet follows the NuGet protocol. These tests will be used to verify the migration to System.Text.Json and route-to-code (instead of Newtonsoft.Json and controllers).

In the future more integration tests will be added for things like:

1. APIs that modify data (upload, unlist)
1. Custom BaGet endpoints (readme, icon, dependents) 
1. More complex API interactions (search filters, autocomplete filters)

title: Support using the database for package and symbol storage
body:

Today customers must use the filesystem, S3, Azure Blob Storage, or Google Cloud Storage to store packages and symbols.

Customers should be able to store their content in the database.

title: Documentation error for Docker port
body:
The documentation at https://loic-sharma.github.io/BaGet/installation/docker/ states:

> You can now run BaGet:
> `docker run --rm --name nuget-server -p 5555:5000 --env-file baget.env -v "$(pwd)/baget-data:/var/baget" loicsharma/baget:latest`

I tried this, but my TCP connections kept getting closed.
Then I saw port 80 was exposed by the container, That one DOES host the webserver. Published port 80, now everything works fine.

Hi, I have a BaGet docker instance with **mirror** feature enabled.

Sometimes the mirrored nupkg file was stored as `0` size file due to server network issue. In this case, the baget server would never succeed to re-mirror the nupkg again.

I have to delete the empty nupkg file manually to make it work again.

My proposal is to enable overriding existing nupkg file if that package is failed to mirror in the last time.

title: S3 AssumeRoleArn "Unable to assume role" error
Normalize icon entry path prior to extraction
body:
This package cannot be pushed to BaGet on Linux: https://www.nuget.org/packages/Microsoft.Build.NoTargets/1.0.88

This is because the .nuspec has a back slash `\` for the icon path. This works just fine on nuget.org (normalization is in place) and BaGet on Windows (both slashes are acceptable). Forward slash on Linux also works fine.

This is the API that NuGetGallery uses:
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/5b7c505086fae24912f3b0d3df58ffb5a9d1e8b8/src/NuGetGallery.Core/Services/FIleNameHelper.cs#L81

The error message is:
```
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: images\MSBuild-NuGet-Icon.png
   at NuGet.Packaging.ZipArchiveExtensions.LookupEntry(ZipArchive zipArchive, String path)
   at NuGet.Packaging.ZipArchiveExtensions.OpenFile(ZipArchive zipArchive, String path)
   at NuGet.Packaging.PackageArchiveReader.GetStream(String path)
   at NuGet.Packaging.PackageReaderBase.GetStreamAsync(String path, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at BaGet.Core.PackageArchiveReaderExtensions.GetIconAsync(PackageArchiveReader package, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in /home/joel/BaGet/src/BaGet.Core/Extensions/PackageArchiveReaderExtensions.cs:line 54
   at BaGet.Core.PackageIndexingService.IndexAsync(Stream packageStream, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in /home/joel/BaGet/src/BaGet.Core/Indexing/PackageIndexingService.cs:line 61
```

title: [SDK] Usability improvements
body:
Improves `BaGet.Protocol`:

* Renamed `GetPackageStreamAsync` to `DownloadPackageAsync`
* Renamed `GetPackageManifestStreamAsync` to `DownloadPackageManifestAsync`
* Replaced `GetRegistrationLeafOrNullAsync` by `GetRegistrationLeafAsync` which accepts a URL to a registration leaf. The previous method made assumptions that may not be correct on all V3 servers.

⚠ These are breaking changes!

title: private feeds via nginx reverse proxy (workaround)
Bringing back too much data when deleting a package?
body:
We were getting _very_ good performance from BaGet in the case of uploading new packages to BaGet. Much better than the Octopus Deploy internal NuGet server. (BaGet took over 50% less time!)

However, we were about to go live in our development environment with a BaGet server instance and then performance tanked. **To be clear, I am NOT saying that what follows is THE cause of the performance issue we're experiencing. It is just something I happened to notice in the code that doesn't look right. The performance issue we're experiencing _could_ be the result of what I found, or it could be something else entirely within our environment or both! We're still trying to make that determination.** So with that caveat out of the way, here's what I found.

My team and I traced down the call stack and landed at the `PackageService`. We have BaGet configured to allow package overwrites.  When replacing an existing package, a call is eventually made to `HardDeletePackageAsync` in the `PackageService` service:

https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/blob/636c38146791bf7bdaa297587e196508f732cd08/src/BaGet.Core/PackageService.cs#L105-L123

Is it really required to `.Include` both `Dependencies` and `TargetFrameworks` for the package being deleted? It doesn't appear that anything is actually done with the objects being materialized back from the Database—they don't appear to aid in any decisions being made about how or whether the package should be deleted. So why bring them back to the client, only to turn around and delete the `Package` entity?

Based on that, it seems to me that https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/blob/636c38146791bf7bdaa297587e196508f732cd08/src/BaGet.Core/PackageService.cs#L110-L111 should be removed from this query.

title: Push package failed in linux docker when package's icon path contains '\'
body:
### Describe the bug
Pushing a package icon path with '\\' to baget linux container,  will cause __System.IO.FileNotFoundException__.

```
fail: BaGet.Core.PackageIndexingService[0]
      Uploaded package is invalid
System.IO.FileNotFoundException: icons\mailkit-50.png
   at NuGet.Packaging.ZipArchiveExtensions.LookupEntry(ZipArchive zipArchive, String path)
   at NuGet.Packaging.ZipArchiveExtensions.OpenFile(ZipArchive zipArchive, String path)
   at NuGet.Packaging.PackageArchiveReader.GetStream(String path)
   at NuGet.Packaging.PackageReaderBase.GetStreamAsync(String path, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at BaGet.Core.PackageArchiveReaderExtensions.GetIconAsync(PackageArchiveReader package, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in /src/BaGet.Core/Extensions/PackageArchiveReaderExtensions.cs:line 54
   at BaGet.Core.PackageIndexingService.IndexAsync(Stream packageStream, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in /src/BaGet.Core/Indexing/PackageIndexingService.cs:line 61
```


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using latest BaGet image DIGEST '3fcb1e9f22c7'
1. Push [MailKit-2.4.1](https://www.nuget.org/packages/MailKit/2.4.1) to BaGet.
1. See error

### Additional context
After some digging, I found something interesting.

According to PackageArchiveReader:

https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/blob/bd440199ba16f62bdb0c157c69b6479f3e2aa9f9/src/BaGet.Core/Extensions/PackageArchiveReaderExtensions.cs#L50-L55

And Nuget.Packaging:

https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/e59333e773bbc4fed97e5534fe88e25332ca04b0/src/NuGet.Core/NuGet.Packaging/PackageArchiveReader.cs#L140-L150

```
        public override Stream GetStream(string path)
        {
            Stream stream = null;
            path = path.Replace(Path.DirectorySeparatorChar, Path.AltDirectorySeparatorChar);
            if (!string.IsNullOrEmpty(path))
            {
                stream = _zipArchive.OpenFile(path);
            }

            return stream;
        }
```

`package.NuspecReader.GetIcon()` return icon path in nuspec, it could be window-style or linux-style. When it's windows-style, and BaGet is running in linux, `            path = path.Replace(Path.DirectorySeparatorChar, Path.AltDirectorySeparatorChar);` will not replace '\\' to '/'.

I'm not sure it is a BaGet bug or a Nuget.Packaging bug, any thoughts?

title: Timeouts when using NFS as storage in kubernetes
body:
### Describe the bug
I get timeouts during push or download packages when using NFS as storage in kubernetes cluster.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet: latest from dockerhub (loicsharma/baget:636c38146791bf7bdaa297587e196508f732cd08)
Kubernetes: v1.16.2
2. Deploy in kubernetes cluster via yml:
```yaml
apiVersion: v1
kind: Namespace
metadata:
  name: utils
---
apiVersion: v1
kind: Service
metadata:
  namespace: utils
  name: baget
spec:
  ports:
    - name: http
      port: 80
      nodePort: 31125
  type: "NodePort"
  selector:
    product: utils
    service: baget
---
apiVersion: apps/v1
kind: Deployment
metadata:
  namespace: utils
  name: baget
spec:
  selector:
    matchLabels:
      product: utils
      service: baget
  replicas: 1
  template:
    metadata:
      labels:
        product: utils
        service: baget
    spec:
      containers:
        - name: baget
          image: loicsharma/baget:636c38146791bf7bdaa297587e196508f732cd08
          imagePullPolicy: Always
          volumeMounts:
            - name: nfs-volume
              mountPath: /app/packages
          env:
            - name: Storage__Path
              value: '/app/packages'
            - name: Database__Type
              value: SqlServer
            - name: Database__ConnectionString
              value: "Server=<SERVER_IP>;Database=nuget;User Id=<USER>;Password=<PASS>"
            - name: ApiKey
              value: API_KEY
      volumes:
        - name: nfs-volume
          nfs:
            server: <NFS_IP>
            path: /files/nfs4/nuget
      terminationGracePeriodSeconds: 30
  strategy:
    type: RollingUpdate
    rollingUpdate:
      maxSurge: 1
      maxUnavailable: 0
  minReadySeconds: 10
```

3. Deploy nginx proxy for kubernetes:
```
server {
    server_name nuget;
    listen              <Nginx_IP>:443 ssl;
    ssl_certificate     /xxx/crt/bundle.pem;
    ssl_certificate_key /xxx/privateKey.pem;
    ssl_protocols       TLSv1 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2;
    ssl_ciphers         HIGH:!aNULL:!MD5;

    access_log   /var/log/nginx/nuget.access.log;
    error_log    /var/log/nginx/nuget.error.log;

    location / {
        proxy_pass http://kubernetes:31125;
        proxy_http_version      1.1;
        proxy_cache_bypass      $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header        Upgrade                 $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header        Connection              keep-alive;
        proxy_set_header        Host                    $host;
        proxy_set_header        X-Forwarded-For         $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header        X-Forwarded-Proto       $scheme;
        proxy_set_header        X-Forwarded-Host        $host:$server_port;
        proxy_set_header        X-Forwarded-Port        $server_port;
        proxy_set_header        X-Real-IP               $remote_addr;
    }
}
```
4. See error

### Expected behavior
Packages should push and download without errors.
### Additional context
Log from nginx:
```
2020/05/08 11:10:18 [error] 29591#0: *9098 upstream timed out (110: Connection timed out) while reading response header from upstream, client: 10.8.0.18, server: nuget, request: "GET /v3/package/xxx/1.0.0/xxx.1.0.0.nupkg HTTP/1.1", upstream: "http://<Kubernetes_IP>:31125/v3/package/xxx/1.0.0/xxx.1.0.0.nupkg", host: "nuget", referrer: "https://nuget/packages/xxx"
```

I'm able to crate and read files in /app/packages from shell in kubernetes pod.
When I deployed BaGet without nfs mount everything works fine.

Any idea how to solve this problem?
Thanks


Edit:
I also checked configure NFS via PVC.
Same situation.
BaGet create dictionaries, .nupkg file (file is empty) and no entries in db.

body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I'm running out of disk space when pushing Nuget packages built with CI. 

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be great to be able to set a disk quota for private packages. When disk quota is reached oldest packages are deleted.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
If auto sweeping packages is not an option, it wold be great to be able to setup a webhook Baget will call when disk quota is reached.

### Additional context
Baget will need to maintain date based package index somewhere.

title: Refactor BaGet's architecture
body:
⚠️ This pull request has several breaking changes. I apologize for any pain this may cause.

Refactors several pieces of BaGet's architecture:

* Renamed the `BaGet.Core.Server` project to `BaGet.Hosting`, it will contain ASP.NET Core integration bits
* Unified the hosts used to run commands and the service
* Updated the integration tests to use the `WebApplicationFactory` pattern
* Reduced the number of namespaces

title: Let environment variables overwrite configuration file settings
body:
In case of ambiguity, environment variables are overwritten by configuration file settings, this should be the other way around. (Environment variables should have a higher priority.)

This PR changes the order of applying configuration variables.

title: Multiple mirrors
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
When I want to mirror two or more nuget servers, I can't configure this. Otherwise I get:

```
Unhandled exception. System.FormatException: A duplicate key 'Mirror:Enabled' was found.
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json.JsonConfigurationFileParser.VisitValue(JsonElement value)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json.JsonConfigurationFileParser.VisitElement(JsonElement element)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json.JsonConfigurationFileParser.VisitValue(JsonElement value)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json.JsonConfigurationFileParser.VisitElement(JsonElement element)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json.JsonConfigurationFileParser.ParseStream(Stream input)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.Json.JsonConfigurationProvider.Load(Stream stream)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.FileConfigurationProvider.Load(Boolean reload)
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.FileConfigurationProvider.HandleException(ExceptionDispatchInfo info)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.FileConfigurationProvider.Load(Boolean reload)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.FileConfigurationProvider.Load()
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.ConfigurationRoot..ctor(IList`1 providers)
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Configuration.ConfigurationBuilder.Build()
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.HostBuilder.BuildAppConfiguration()
   at Microsoft.Extensions.Hosting.HostBuilder.Build()
   at BaGet.Program.<>c__DisplayClass0_0.<<Main>b__1>d.MoveNext() in D:\a\1\s\src\BaGet\Program.cs:line 45
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at McMaster.Extensions.CommandLineUtils.CommandLineApplicationExtensions.<>c__DisplayClass9_0.<<OnExecuteAsync>b__0>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at McMaster.Extensions.CommandLineUtils.CommandLineApplication.ExecuteAsync(String[] args, CancellationToken cancellationToken)
   at BaGet.Program.Main(String[] args) in D:\a\1\s\src\BaGet\Program.cs:line 51
   at BaGet.Program.<Main>(String[] args)
```

When I try it with a configuration like this:

```
  "Mirror": {
    "Enabled": true,
    "PackageSource": "https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json"
  },

  "Mirror": {
    "Enabled": true,
    "PackageSource": "https://www.myget.org/F/caliburn-micro-builds/api/v3/index.json"
  },  
```

### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be nice if we could have more than one mirror. The mirroring should be like this. If you don't find it on the first mirror try the next one (like a chain).
This allows to add specific alternatives that may have already newer packages (e.g. like myget in this case).

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I could add multiple URLs to the project itself (nuget.config) but it would be nice if we could serve this by a single BaGet.

title: Baget doesn't allow setting Mirror options via environment variables
body:
### Describe the bug

The default production `appsettings.json` file explicitly disables mirroring—which is a sound, sensible default. However, due to the order in which configuration is applied in `ConfigureBagetConfiguration', with environment variables being added first, followed by the settings in `appsettings.json`, this effectively means that when running Baget in a docker container, it's impossible to change this setting.

### To Reproduce

1. Run the following commands:
    ```powershell
    docker pull loicsharma/baget:latest
    docker run `
    >> --name  baget-server -d -p 8800:80 `
    >> -e Mirror__Enabled=true -e Mirror__PackageSource=https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
    >> -e AllowPackageOverwrites=true `
    >> --mount type=bind,src=D:\var\opt\baget\pkgs,dst=/var/baget loicsharma/baget:latest
    ```
2. Navigate in your browser to the baget-server.
3. No NuGet.org packages show up in the interface when searching for them.

### Expected behavior

I expected to see packages from Nuget.org show up when I search for them (or even when just simply navigating to the baget server).

### Additional context

The only way to effectively do this right now is to create your own docker image based on the official baget image and add a layer which adds a modified `appsettings.json` file.

But I think this could be fixed by reordering the code [here](https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/blob/9c5a9f38896a5b70f6bc66b17c1c94543af39c2a/src/BaGet/Extensions/IHostBuilderExtensions.cs#L15-L19) in `ConfigureBagetConfiguration`. Basically, lines 15 and 17 ought to be swapped such that the `appsettings.json` is loaded first, then the environment variables are loaded. In this way, if no environment variables are supplied, then the prevailing configuration in `appsettings.json` applies. But if environment variable are supplied, they can override the settings in `appsettings.json`.

I can put in a PR for this a little bit later today.

title: Fix #490 - package last updated date
body:
Fixes #490 by using `Date.prototype.toLocaleDateString()` to format date values used to show when a package was last updated.

Addresses https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/490

title: UI: Package last updated date - shown in US format in other locales
body:
When viewing a package, the `Last updated` field shows the date in US format (`MM/DD/YYYY`), rather than the locale's format. This format [appears to be hard-coded](https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/blob/master/src/BaGet.UI/src/DisplayPackage/Versions.tsx#L101).

### Describe the solution you'd like

Ideally the date should be rendered using the browser locale settings. This can be done using [`Date.prototype.toLocaleDateString`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/toLocaleDateString)

title: push packages error 405 (Not Allowed). BaGet on Linux with Nginx    I found the problem
body:
### push packages error 405 (Not Allowed). BaGet on Linux with Nginx 
- error: Response status code does not indicate success: 405 (Not Allowed).
![avatar](http://cdn.layui.com/upload/2020_3/3712296_1583154290823_63869.png)

- I found the problem
```c#
because:

Baget should request this address : http://192.168.204.129:2000/api/v2/package

but Baget  request this address : http://192.168.204.129/api/v2/package
```
### Step by Step
 

### the service file
```c#
[Unit]
Description=Example .NET Web API App running on Ubuntu

[Service]
WorkingDirectory=/www/wwwroot/BaGet.com
ExecStart=/usr/bin/dotnet /www/wwwroot/BaGet.com/BaGet.dll
Restart=always
# Restart service after 10 seconds if the dotnet service crashes:
RestartSec=10
KillSignal=SIGINT
SyslogIdentifier=dotnet-example
User=root
Environment=ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT=Production
Environment=DOTNET_PRINT_TELEMETRY_MESSAGE=false

[Install]
WantedBy=multi-user.target
```

### Configure Nginx
```c#
server {
    listen        2000;
    server_name   192.168.204.129;
    location / {
        proxy_pass         http://localhost:5000;
        proxy_http_version 1.1;
        proxy_set_header   Upgrade $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header   Connection keep-alive;
        proxy_set_header   Host $host;
        proxy_cache_bypass $http_upgrade;
        proxy_set_header   X-Forwarded-For $proxy_add_x_forwarded_for;
        proxy_set_header   X-Forwarded-Proto $scheme;
    }
}
```

title: ArgumentNullException for autocompleteUrl using Azure Artifacts feed
body:
When using `NuGetClient` with an Azure Artifacts feed, calling `GetPackageMetadataAsync` throws an `ArgumentNullException` for `autocompleteUrl`.

### To Reproduce

1. Create a public Azure Artifacts NuGet feed. I have an empty one at https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/mysqlnet/MySqlConnector/_packaging/test/nuget/v3/index.json
2. Install BaGet.Protocol 0.3.0-preview2
3. Run this code:

```csharp
var client = new NuGetClient("https://pkgs.dev.azure.com/mysqlnet/MySqlConnector/_packaging/test/nuget/v3/index.json");
await client.GetPackageMetadataAsync("Test");
```

4. There's an unhandled exception:

```
ArgumentNullException: Value cannot be null. (Parameter 'autocompleteUrl')
   at BaGet.Protocol.Internal.RawSearchClient..ctor(HttpClient httpClient, String searchUrl, String autocompleteUrl) in D:\a\1\s\src\BaGet.Protocol\Search\RawSearchClient.cs:line 33
   at BaGet.Protocol.NuGetClientFactory.GetAsync[T](Func`2 clientFactory, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in D:\a\1\s\src\BaGet.Protocol\NuGetClientFactory.cs:line 151
   at BaGet.Protocol.NuGetClientFactory.PackageMetadataClient.GetRegistrationIndexOrNullAsync(String packageId, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in D:\a\1\s\src\BaGet.Protocol\PackageMetadata\PackageMetadataClient.cs:line 24
   at BaGet.Protocol.NuGetClient.GetPackageMetadataAsync(String packageId, CancellationToken cancellationToken) in D:\a\1\s\src\BaGet.Protocol\NuGetClient.cs:line 200
```

### Expected behavior

That BaGet.Protocol should be able to retrieve package metadata from Azure Artifacts, even if all NuGet API v3 services aren't exposed.

title: Cannot publish symbol package if version contains upper case characters
body:
Cannot publish symbol package if the package version contains upper case characters in a prerelease identifier (e.g. 1.0.0-RC1).

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create package + symbols package with version Major.Minor.Patch-[Build Identifier containing upper case characters] (e.g.: 1.0.0-RC1)
`dotnet pack -c Release -o ../nuget/ -p:Version=1.0.0-RC1 -p:SymbolPackageFormat=snupkg --include-symbols`

2. Publish package:
`dotnet nuget push *.nupkg -s $BAGET_URL -k $BAGET_API_KEY`

3. Result is:
Nuget package is pushed successfully
Symbols package is NOT pushed (404)

### Expected behavior
Both packages should be pushed.

### Screenshots
Result of `dotnet nuget push`
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1415803/74366610-9e254380-4dd0-11ea-9528-949970a252e8.png)

### Additional context
The workflow succeeds, if no uppercase characters are present (e.g. 1.0.0-rc2).

        * [ ] Upload package with icon (before migration)

        * [ ] Upload package with iconUrl
        * [ ] Upload package with icon

title: [PostgreSQL] No longer require restart after creating the database
body:
Npgsql, the PostgreSQL driver, caches the database's type information on the initial connection. This causes issues when BaGet creates the database as it adds the citext extension to support case insensitive columns. BaGet will now forcefully reload the database's types after migrations are run.

See: https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/442
See: https://github.com/npgsql/efcore.pg/issues/170#issuecomment-303417225

title: Make the "Version" column case insensitive
body:
## Background

BaGet is case sensitive on versions, which prevents unlisting/deleting a package that has uppercased letters in its version string (see https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/458). This only affects the SQLite and PostgreSQL drivers.

### SQLite

⚠SQLite does not support altering columns (see [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/providers/sqlite/limitations#migrations-limitations)). Customers will need to recreate their database and then reupload all their packages to get this fix:

1. Delete the SQLite database: `rm baget.db`
1. Run BaGet to recreate the database
1. Reupload all the packages:
    1. Navigate to your storage folder: `cd packages`
    1. Push all packages: `dotnet nuget push .\**\*.nupkg --source http://localhost:5000/v3/index.json`

### Implementation

<details>
<summary>Test plan</summary>

* [x] PostgreSQL
    * [X] Test on a fresh database
    * [x] Test on an existing database after migrating
* [x] SQLite
    * [X] Test on a fresh database
    * [x] Test migration no-ops on an existing database
    * [x] Add instructions on how to rebuild SQLite database 
</details>

title: Error pushing huge packages on IIS (413 Payload Too Large)

title: Allow the use of secret files for configuration
body:
Allows users to use Docker secrets, or bind-mounted plain text files to provide settings values.

ASP.NET Documentation available [here](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/fundamentals/configuration/?view=aspnetcore-3.1#key-per-file-configuration-provider).

This also allows the prevention of exposing sensitive values in environment variables.

Both `AddKeyPerFile` calls appear to be necessary to make this work in all cases at present, pending the merge of `WebHostBuilder` and `HostBuilder` implementation.

An example `docker-compose.yml` file that makes use of this functionality:
```yaml
version: '2'

services:
  baget:
    build: .
    image: baget:secrets-configuration
    volumes:
      - ./data/secrets/connectionstring:/run/secrets/Database__ConnectionString:ro
      - ./data/secrets/apikey:/run/secrets/ApiKey:ro
      - ./data/db/:/db/
      - ./data/packages:/var/baget/packages
    environment:
      - Database__Type=Sqlite
      - Mirror__Enabled=true
      - Mirror__PackageSource=https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json
      - Storage__Type=FileSystem
      - Storage__Path=/var/baget/packages
    ports:
      - '8000:80'
```

title: Can't list packages from BaGet
body:
### Describe the bug
I'm trying to get a list of versions of one package in my local feed (basically to clean up pre-release ones) but with no luck.

I've tried so far:
1. Nuget CLI.
2. Console app, using BaGet SDK.

Both do not work.

### To Reproduce
1. Run command 
```nuget.exe list [PackageName] -AllVersions -Source "http://[bageturl]/v3/index.json"```

OR

2.1. Create a console app with code from SDK documentation:
```
var packageName = [PackageName];
var client = new NuGetClient("http://[bageturl]/v3/index.json");

// Find the metadata for all versions of a package.
var items = await client.GetPackageMetadataAsync(packageName);
if (!items.Any())
{
    Console.WriteLine($"Package '{packageName}' does not exist");
    return;
}

foreach (var metadata in items)
{
    Console.WriteLine($"Version: {metadata.Version}");
    Console.WriteLine($"Listed: {metadata.Listed}");
    Console.WriteLine($"Tags: {metadata.Tags}");
    Console.WriteLine($"Description: {metadata.Description}");
}
```
2.2. Run it.

### Expected behavior
1. A list of packages is returned

2. List of '[PackageName]' package metadata is printed to console.

### Actual behavior
1. No packages are returned. The following warning is displayed:

> WARNING: This version of nuget.exe does not support listing packages from package source 'http://[bageturl]/v3/index.json'.

2.  Code throws an exception at line:
```var items = await client.GetPackageMetadataAsync(packageName);```

title: installing package dependencies in Read-Through Caching
body:
### Describe the bug
When I install a package from nuget.org source it installs all package dependencies, but when I install the package from baget source(in Read-Through Caching mode) it installs only the package itself not its dependencies.

What is the probelm?

title: Define navigation properties for PackageKey to remove shadow properties
body:
Remove shadow properties

* Add `public int PackageKey { get; set; }` property to the PackageType, and TargetFramework entities and `public int PackageKey { get; set; }` to PackageDependency
* Added `Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Design` to `BaGet` project as required for migrations
* Generated new migrations (I left empty migrations in place to show they were ran for all databases as there were some changes due to EF upgrade I think)

Addresses https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/445

title: Refactor download tracking
body: Previously the `IPackageService.AddDownloadAsync` returned `false` if the package does not exist, which was used to determine whether we should 404 the package download request. This coupling of "does the package exist" with "track the download" isn't necessary and makes it harder to add buffering to download tracking.

title: [WIP] Improve error handling on misconfigurations
body:
I have started looking at how this can be improved. One option is to use a StartupFilter ([see Andrew Lock's blog](https://andrewlock.net/adding-validation-to-strongly-typed-configuration-objects-in-asp-net-core/)) this builds on the existing config validation code and just runs all the validation at startup instead of when a config section is first used.

There are still some options which are used before the validation happens and enums which are not valid are not handled.

Addresses https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/408

title: Gracefully handle mirroring failures for offline scenarios
body: Addresses https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/432

title: Support “reflowing” packages
body:
## Problem

As new features are added to BaGet, already uploaded packages may need to be reprocessed. This is referred to as “reflowing” on NuGet.org. 

For example, see: https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/pull/438#issuecomment-576578513

## Workaround

Today, you’ll need to:

1. Enable package hard deletion (see this [documentation](https://loic-sharma.github.io/BaGet/configuration/#enable-package-hard-deletions))
1. Download the packages you’d like to reprocess
1. Delete the packages using [`dotnet nuget delete`](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/core/tools/dotnet-nuget-delete)
1. Reupload the packages

title: Remove shadow properties
body:
## Bug

If BaGet is started in debug mode it will log:

```
dbug: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Model.Validation[10600]
      The property 'PackageKey' on entity type 'PackageDependency' was created in shadow state because there are no eligible CLR members with a matching name.
dbug: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Model.Validation[10600]
      The property 'PackageKey' on entity type 'PackageType' was created in shadow state because there are no eligible CLR members with a matching name.
dbug: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Model.Validation[10600]
      The property 'PackageKey' on entity type 'TargetFramework' was created in shadow state because there are no eligible CLR members with a matching name.
```

These logs were added in EF Core 3.

## Fix

1. Add a `public int PackageKey { get; set; }` property to the `PackageType`, `PackageDependency`, and `TargetFramework` entities.
1. Generate new migrations, if any

## Additional Context

See the documentation on shadow properties: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/ef/core/modeling/shadow-properties#foreign-key-shadow-properties

title: PostgreSQL driver is broken after database is created
body:
### Describe the bug
BaGet must be restarted after installing a new PostgreSQL database due to the following error message:

> Npgsql.NpgsqlException (0x80004005): The NpgsqlDbType 'Citext' isn't present in your database.


### Work around

Restart BaGet to fix this issue.

### To Reproduce

1. Install PostgreSQL
1. Delete BaGet's database if it exists
1. Start BaGet
1. Verify the PostgreSQL database has been created
1. Try to push a package. This will fail

### Additional context

This bug is caused by: https://github.com/npgsql/efcore.pg/issues/170

> The problem is that the first time Npgsql connects to a given database, it loads all of that database's type information and caches that for all further connections. Unfortunately, on your first connection the `citext` type isn't present in your database yet (since the extension hasn't been added yet), and so your connections aren't aware of it.
> 
> The solution is to call `NpgsqlConnection.ReloadTypes()` on your NpgsqlConnection after the citext extension is added - this will trigger a reloading of the types and should resolve your issue.

<details>
<summary>Full exception</summary>

```
fail: Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Database.Command[20102]
      Failed executing DbCommand (2ms) [Parameters=[@__id_0='?', @__ToNormalizedString_1='?' (Size = 64)], CommandType='Text', CommandTimeout='30']
      SELECT CASE
          WHEN EXISTS (
              SELECT 1
              FROM "Packages" AS p
              WHERE (p."Id" = @__id_0) AND (p."Version" = @__ToNormalizedString_1))
          THEN TRUE::bool ELSE FALSE::bool
      END
Npgsql.NpgsqlException (0x80004005): The NpgsqlDbType 'Citext' isn't present in your database. You may need to install an extension or upgrade to a newer version.
   at Npgsql.TypeMapping.ConnectorTypeMapper.GetByNpgsqlDbType(NpgsqlDbType npgsqlDbType) in C:\projects\npgsql\src\Npgsql\TypeMapping\ConnectorTypeMapper.cs:line 106

title: [UI] Packages without exactly 3 semver digits fail
body:
### Describe the bug
The UI breaks when trying to display any package who's version does not follow the form "a.b.c".  For example a package with version "1.2.3.4".

The error comes from a call to `semver.gt` to sort package versions.  The `semver` package is very strict about version numbers, so it breaks in this case.  There is a `semver.coerce` function that does its best effort to turn a version string into a "valid" version, and I would recommend using that to at least keep the UI working.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using the latest version of BaGet
2. In the UI, navigate to a package that uses four-digit semantic versions (`NUnit` is an example)
3. Notice the following error in the developer console:
```
Failed to load package. TypeError: Invalid Version: 2.5.9.10348
    at new f (semver.js:256)
    at g (semver.js:596)
    at v (semver.js:638)
    at t.value (DisplayPackage.tsx:325)
    at DisplayPackage.tsx:123
```
4. The page fails to load.

### Expected behavior
No error.

title: using BaGet offline with read-through caching fails instead of simply providing the cached version
body:
### Describe the bug
When the internet connection is lost (yeah, I have that occasionally, as you can see from my other opened issue about offline usage. I develop while taking a train, from time to time), BaGet with read-through caching enabled seems to still try and fetch the most recent information about packages from the external source (e.g. nuget.org). Ideally, it should just hit the local cache, and retry to update external package information later (with exponential backoff).

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set up BaGet with read-through cache of nuget.org
2. Make sure at least one package is cached
3. Go offline
4. Try and restore a project using said package
5. Observe error 500 returned from BaGet

### Expected behavior
Hit cache even when offline, optionally retrying to fetch most recent info later when connectivity is restored.

title: using BaGet offline creates infinite loop without backoff for package icons
body:
### Describe the bug
When the machine BaGet is running on loses internet connection, loading the index page leads to an infinite loop of errors trying to load the package icons. Ideally, the attempts to load the icons should be tried with exponential backoff, not immediately after it failed.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Set up BaGet, having at least one package present
2. Disconnect internet (can also be emulated by setting offline mode in browser dev tools after the initial page load, but that's a little bit difficult to time)
3. Load the page
4. See error in dev tools:
Request to https://www.nuget.org/Content/gallery/img/default-package-icon-256x256.png fails in endless loop.

### Expected behavior
The immediate retry also leads to "flashing" of the icon area. So implementing exponential backoff would be appropriate for any external component.

title: Dependencies link incorrect for "external" nuget source/repository...?
body:
Hi Loic,

I have your latest BaGet Docker image (as of about a week ago), and have been using BaGet for many months now, and it works great!

----
On a web browser, when I click on a package (example):

`http://10.2.1.237:9011/packages/Some.Library`

I can see the:

[ down arrow ] Dependencies

When I click on the "down arrow", I'm presented with clickable links to the dependencies that Some.Library depends on -which are a mix of packages that "live" in 2 different sources/repositories:

1. My local repository (which is **10.2.1.237:9011**).
2. **nuget.org**

If I click on a dependency in (1), I'm correctly taken to that local dependency with no problems.

If I click on a dependency in (2) -example: **Newtonsoft.Json**, I'm taken to:

`http://10.2.1.237:9011/packages/Newtonsoft.Json`

`Could not find package 'newtonsoft.json'.
`
----
**I understand the error and what is going on, but how should the behavior for (2) be...?**

Should it be:

3. There is no link for (2) external dependencies -instead it is just plain text on the web page.

4. Is there a way  to define (in the *.nuspec)  for the source of an external dependency in (2) -from what I understand, there is no way to do this.


Thanks,
George H.
11/20/2019 9:40am ET

title: BaGet release (1.0.0)
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

All BaGet releases to date are, I think, either pre-releases or previews. This raises concern that BaGet is not ready for production use. 

The problem arises from the release SemVer. All have a major version number of '0' which indicates early development and all have a "-" suffix which explicitly indicates pre-release. The also have the word "prerelease" or "preview".

Some, like me, only really want to take a release.

### Describe the solution you'd like

So the feature request is either to provide a 1.0.0 release.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

* Indicate a time when one is planned.
* Do nothing - leaves indication that releases are not production ready.

### Additional context
NuGet uses SemVer versioning as does the BaGet GitHub. It is a great way to communicate releases.

title: Unchecking the Include prerelease checkbox does not remove prerelease packages
body:
### Describe the bug
When searching for packages the pre release packages are always included in the search results

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet '0.2.0-preview1', IIS installation on prem.
2. Upload a prerelease package of any nuget, ie system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview1.19504.10.nupkg
3. Upload a release package of the same nuget, ie system.data.sqlclient.4.7.0.nupkg
4. Open BaGet interface
5. Uncheck the Include prerelease checkbox
6. Search for yournuget
7. Observe which nuget version is returned
8. Click the link to the package
9. Observe nuget version
10. Observe list of Versions
11. Download Package
12. Observe version of package

### Actual behaviour
7. The system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview1.19504.10.nupkg is shown as the latest version
9. Details are shown for version system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview1.19504.10.nupkg
10. Both prerelease and release packages are shown but sorted in date order and not in version order. Sorting from first to latest
12. system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview1.19504.10.nupkg is downloaded
### Expected behavior
7. The latest released version of is shown, ie system.data.sqlclient.4.7.0.nupkg
9. Details shown for version system.data.sqlclient.4.7.0.nupkg
10. Both prerelase and release packages shown sorted from highest version number to lowest, The Package system.data.sqlclient.4.7.0.nupkg is highlighted or something.
12. system.data.sqlclient.4.7.0.nupkg downloaded

### Additional context
Upload the package system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview2.19523.17.nupkg
From visual studio 2019, open manage package for solution tab, make sure the include prerelase checkbox is not checked, search for system.data.sqlclient.
The prerelease package system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview2.19523.17.nupkg is included in the search result (this differs from when searching nuget.org) but not system.data.sqlclient.4.8.0-preview1.19504.10.nupkg. 
If the include prerelease checkbox is checked both packages are included.
Expected result for the first case would be that no prerelease package should be included.

Also note that when searching on the web page you have to enter some text to be able to uncheck the include prerelase checkbox, then if you clear the search box the include prerelase is checked again. 
My preferences would be:
1. I would like to have it the other way around, that include prerelease is not checked (but thats just an opinion)
2. The checkbox is shown all the time
3. The choice is stored for the duration of my visit to the nuget server page

title: Package search ignores prerelease and other query parameters
body:
### Package search ignores prerelease and other query parameters
When using database (Sqlite in our case) search for latest package returns prerelease packages even when prerelease is explicitly passed as false.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet 'v0.2.0-preview1' and '0.1.77-prerelease' (tested only on those 2)
2. Run 'dotnet run' in folder '.\src\\Buget'
3. Push 2 packages, release and prerelease where prepelease version is greater (like 1.2.3 and 1.2.4-alpha)
4. Run PowerShell Core command `((Invoke-WebRequest -Uri "http://localhost:50561/v3/search?semVerLevel=2.0.0&q=webclient&prerelease=false") | ConvertFrom-Json).Data` where 'webclient' is your package name.
4. See output

### Expected behavior
One record with stable release version

### Actual behavior
One record with prerelease version

title: CLI delete looks like it is working but package is not unlisted
body:
### Describe the bug
When running nuget delete from command line the respons is that nuget is deleted successfully but the nuget still exists on disk and in database and is downloadable 

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet v0.2.0-preview1
2. upload a package package.xyz.nuget.1.0.0.2
3. delete the package with **"nuget delete -Source http://your.path.com/v3/index.json package.xyz 1.0.0.2"**
4. response is:
package.xyz 1.0.0.2 will be deleted from the 'http://your.path.com/api/v2/package'. Would you like to continue? (y/N) y
WARNING: Deleting package.xyz from the 'http://your.path.com/api/v2/package'.
  DELETE http://your.path.com/api/v2/package/package.xyz/1.0.0.2
  NoContent http://your.path.com/api/v2/package/package.xyz/1.0.0.2 115ms
package.xyz 1.0.0.2 was deleted successfully.
5. go to  http://your.path.com/nuget
6. search for package.xyz
7. the package.xyz shows up in the search result with the 1.0.0.2 version as the latest greatest, and it is still possible to download 1.0.0.2
 
### Expected behavior
7. package.xyz should show up in the search result as version 1.0.0.1


### Additional context
The server is configured with 
  "PackageDeletionBehavior": "Unlist",

Note, when changing behaviour to HardDelete the package is deleted ok.

title: feat: Add Sentry for aspnetcore
body: Added the [Sentry](github.com/getsentry/sentry) SDK [for .NET](https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-dotnet). I've added a DSN to an account I own for testing, exemplify what goes in there, and to cause a crash and exemplify the issue page (below). I would remove that before merging, if you decide to merge this. Sentry is FOSS which means people hosting BaGet can also host Sentry for free and simply add their own DSN to `appsettings.json`. I suggest [getting a sponsored account at sentry.io](https://sentry.io/for/open-source/) (it's what we did for [NuGetTrends](https://github.com/NuGetTrends/nuget-trends) and leaving a DSN in the `appsettings.json` to collect crashes happening in installations of BaGet around. IMHO a note on the README.md would be enough, documenting to delete the DSN from `appsettings.json` to opt out. Or defining the environment variable `SENTRY_DSN` to an empty string which does the same. With the integration with GitHub, Sentry can also open issues here from events getting into Sentry. I also suggest setting up [release tracking and suspected commits](https://blog.sentry.io/2018/09/06/expanding-the-sentry-ecosystem-with-new-and-improved-integrations#suspect-commits) if you decide to have a hosted version of baget since that'll tell you likely which commit is involved in the event.

title: Docker Volume Issue
body:
I try to use BaGet as local nuget source, so i wrote the following docker compose file. The baget service runs as expected, but when i delete the container, the network, the volume and after all the image and start over for a clean baget instance i see all previous uploaded and mirrored packages. Which is bad by design and bad to start from the scratch. Btw: I also deleted the offline package store for my local user before.

```
version: '3.7'

volumes:
  baget-data:
      name: baget-data

networks:
  internal-net:
    name: internal-net
    driver: bridge

services:
  baget:
    image: loicsharma/baget:latest
    container_name: baget
    restart: always
    environment:
      - ASPNETCORE_ENVIRONMENT=Production
      - Storage__Type=FileSystem
      - Storage__Path=/var/baget/packages
      - Database__Type=Sqlite
      - Database__ConnectionString=Data Source=/var/baget/baget.db
      - Search__Type=Database
      - ApiKey=MySecretApi
      - AllowPackageOverwrites=true
      - PackageDeletionBehavior=HardDelete
      - Mirror__Enabled=true
    volumes:
      - baget-data:/var/baget
    ports:
      - 5555:80
    networks: 
      - internal-net

```

title: [baget.io] Add Application Insights
body:
Updated on October 13th, 2019 at 10:23am:

> ... I'd like to balance privacy concerns with convenience. .... At this time, I believe that Application Insights is an acceptable solution **so long as I can prevent Application Insights from collecting users' personal information** (like IP addresses, network, and whatever else could be used for tracking). In effect, the only information that would be captured on baget.io are exceptions, network requests initiated by the front-end, and custom metrics the front-end emits (if any). **If you self-host BaGet, Application Insights will be disabled and it won't collect telemetry**. In addition, I've reviewed Application Insight's documentation:
> 
> 1. Microsoft does not access Application Insights telemetry without permission ([source](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/app/data-retention-privacy#how-secure-is-my-data))
> 1. Microsoft uses Application Insights data only to provide the service to Application Insights customers ([source](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/azure-monitor/app/data-retention-privacy#what-does-microsoft-do-with-the-information-my-app-sends-to-application-insights))

title: Order packages by version
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
I want to sort packages in my query by version number descending but for some cases I can't do that. Let's say that I have a package with version `101.0.0.0` and `11.0.0.0`. If I use NormalizedVersionString or OriginalVersionString, it results like below:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4133525/65409679-0018e880-ddf1-11e9-8857-f45c7e5bfdbc.png)


### Describe the solution you'd like
It would be good to have an integer field for VersionNumber like 1000*MajorVersion+100*MinorVersion etc... Or having 4 fields (MajorVersion, MinorVersion, etc...) would be better.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
I can clone the source code BaGet and add those fields but I would prefer to hear your suggestion first.


By the way, using `OrderByDescending(e=> e.Version.Major)` was working before but since EF Core 3.0 disabled client side query execution, it is not useful anymore.

Thanks.

title: [Client SDK] Standardize SDK best practices
body:
* [x] Newtonsoft.Json converters should be internal
* [x] Remove model immutability. Remove constructors, add property setters
* [x] Add explicit `[JsonProperty("json property name here")]` to all properties
* [x] Move all models to a single folder (including ModelExtensions, like catalog's)
* [ ] ~~Add `ConfigureAwait` on all client calls~~
* [X] Decide approach for complex model values
    * Catalog models use "simple" types and expose extension methods to parse versions/version ranges/target framework.
        * Customers have to use extension methods to access models' high-level types.
        * ✔ This gives clients the most flexibility when servers have malformed responses. A client can add custom logic to inspect the low-level value.
        * ❌ This allows server implementations to create incorrect responses using models
    * Other resources use Newtonsoft.Json converters.
        * ✔ This is easier for customers as they can use high-level types.
        * ✔ This ensures server implementations create correct responses
        * This is inflexible when servers have malformed responses

title: Create best-in-class NuGet protocol SDK
body:
# Problem

It is difficult to create tooling around the NuGet protocol due to a lack of libraries.

# Solution

Create the best-in-class libraries for the NuGet protocol:

* Well documented: https://loic-sharma.github.io/BaGet/tools/sdk/
* Stable API surface
* Can be used from both .NET Core and .NET Framework
* Clean integration with ASP.NET Core
* Minimal dependencies
* Follows Azure SDK's guidelines: https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/dotnet_introduction.html

# Existing Solutions

* [NuGet.Protocol](https://www.nuget.org/packages/NuGet.Protocol) - The NuGet client team maintains this package. It is extremely powerful, supports both V2 and V3 APIs, and supports private feeds. However, it is difficult to use, poorly documented, tightly coupled with the client's implementation, and does not have a stable API surface.
* [NuGet.Protocol.Catalog](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Services.Metadata/tree/master/src/NuGet.Protocol.Catalog) - The NuGet server team maintains this package. It is .NET Framework only, but well documented and has a stable API surface. This only covers the catalog resource and does not cover other resources like search, autocomplete, package metadata, package content

# Tasks

* Preview 1
    * [x] Improve on-boarding experience https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/305
    * [x] Add the catalog SDK https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/308
    * [x] Standardize SDK best practices https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/322
    * [x] Test performance on large static feeds https://github.com/loic-sharma/baget/issues/304
    * [x] Release https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/340
* Preview 2
    * [ ] Use primitive types in JSON models (ex: strings instead of NuGetVersion)
    * [x] Reduce NuGet.* dependencies (can we use just NuGet.Versioning?)
    * [ ] Rename from `CatalogLeafUrl` to `Url` wherever necessary
    * [ ] `IPackageMetadataClient.GetRegistrationLeafOrNullAsync` should accept a leaf URL (see [this](https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/api/registration-base-url-resource#registration-leaf))
    * [x] Split search and autocomplete SDK https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/468
    * [ ] Don't expose low-level JSON models in high-level SDK
    * [ ] Move to System.Text.Json?
    * [x] Improve XML doc for catalog processor options
    * [ ] Improve test coverage: https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/309
    * [ ] Add dependency injection extensions
    * [ ] Add package publish SDK https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/310
    * [ ] Unlist package SDK
    * [ ] Add symbol publish SDK
    * [ ] Add package signature SDK
    * [x] Add package deprecation  SDK https://github.com/loic-sharma/baget/issues/395
    * [ ] Add license expression to registration (it's in catalog already)
* Future
    * [ ] Add high performance catalog SDK
    * [ ] Support search failover https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/314
    * [ ] Support authentication plugins https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/issues/334

title: [Client SDK] Engage potential partners
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
Partner with key projects in the ecosystem.

### Describe the solution you'd like
Consider:
* [NuGetPackageExplorer](https://github.com/NuGetPackageExplorer/NuGetPackageExplorer/)
* [NuGetTrends](https://github.com/NuGetTrends/nuget-trends)
* [Paket](https://github.com/fsprojects/Paket)
* [FuGet](https://github.com/praeclarum/FuGetGallery)
* [Sleet](https://github.com/emgarten/Sleet)
* [LiGet](https://github.com/ai-traders/liget)
* [NuKeeper](https://github.com/NuKeeperDotNet/NuKeeper/blob/c270e4d0c71a1329bb90a05edbd0a0dce0ef3af7/NuKeeper.Inspection/NuGetApi/PackageVersionsLookup.cs#L48)
* dotnet-outdated. See https://github.com/goenning/dotnet-outdated/pull/13
* Dependabot? Can’t, ruby
* Shields? Can’t, nodejs

Consider .NET Foundation news letter? https://github.com/dotnet-foundation/newsletter

title: [Client SDK] Improve on-boarding experience
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
On-boarding to BaGet's client SDK should be quick and easy.

### Describe the solution you'd like

Work:
* [x] Add documentation
* [x] Add README
* [x] Create samples
* [x] Ensure XML docs are good. Compare w/ Azure SDK
* [x] Update package metadata
* [x] Simplify APIs if necessary
* [x] Ensure Azure SDK guidelines are followed, as necessary: https://azure.github.io/azure-sdk/dotnet_introduction.html
* [x] Minimize public API surface
* [ ] ~~Add fxcop analyzer~~

title: [Client SDK] Test performance on large static feeds
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
[Sleet](https://github.com/emgarten/Sleet) creates large static feeds that require high performance from client libraries.

Example JSON feed: JSON feed: https://dotnetfeed.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet-core/search/query?q=&skip=0&take=15&prerelease=false&semVerLevel=2.0.0 (141 MB, raw, without gzip etc)
See: https://github.com/NuGetPackageExplorer/NuGetPackageExplorer/issues/804

### Describe the solution you'd like
Verify the performance of BaGet's NuGet SDK libraries are acceptable. Consider moving to `System.Text.Json` if necessary (this would help remove the Newtonsoft.Json dependency)

title: Add a landing page when there are no packages
body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
BaGet shows an empty home page when you start it for the first time.

### Describe the solution you'd like
There should be a landing page that shows you how to get started. This page should have links to the upload page and the documentation.

title: Regular nuget packages show up in BaGet
body:
### Describe the bug
Somehow regular/official nuget packages like Newtonsoft.Json show up in my private api-key protected BaGet server. This behavior wasn't present like 4 months ago.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet 'latest docker image'
2. Run this code 'via csproj file my packages are pushed on build'
```
  <Target Name="PushNuGetPackage" AfterTargets="GenerateNuspec" Condition="'$(Configuration)' == 'Release'">
    <Message Text="Push NuGet Package to NuGet Feed" Importance="high"></Message>
    <Exec Command="dotnet nuget push $(ProjectDir)bin\Release\$(PackageId).$(PackageVersion).nupkg -s http://some-baget-server-ip -k SOME-API-KEY"></Exec>
  </Target>
```

### Expected behavior
Maybe this behavior is a new feature in BaGet? But I would like to have my private packages repo to be clean and not filled with regular/official nuget packages.
Also it is remarkable that these regular/official nuget packages got pushed to my api-key protected BaGet server as there is no way the process responsible pushing these official  packages could have my api-key right?

title: exception when a package file is not found
body:
### Describe the bug
Unhandled exception occurs when a package file was not found. Apparently updating _BaGet_ has messed up my package directory structure. I don't care that much about it. The following error could happen to anyone who plays around with file paths.

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet 'master@4d627fa'
2. Play around with the file paths or the database (e.g. rename the package folder by accident)
3. Request the package
4. See log

### Work-around
Lowercase the `Packages` folder to `packages`.

### Expected behavior
A clear sentence about the nupkg file not being found; eventually stating that there is a discrepancy betweend database and filesystem. Anything than a bombardement of the log seems aight.

title: Added support for acting like a Chocolatey server
body:
**Cherry-picked [Mizipzor's contributions from unmerged PR](https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/pull/178), and added support for 'choco install' command**

Original description:


**Added support for acting like a Chocolatey server.**

This includes rudimentary support for api v2 and OData.
Lifted a lot of the core logic from https://github.com/ai-traders/BaGet.
Created Legacy namespace and tried to keep everything contained, would
prefer if Choco added nuget api v3 support.

**Closes Issue(s)**

#43

At least partially, OData queries can be very expressive, I dont know to what extent old nuget clients use it.

**Motivation**

Need it, and want to reuse the same server software between nuget and choco.

title: Cannot push package to server
body:
I cannot push a package to the server where I run a docker container with BaGet. I get the following error:
```
info : Pushing InnoData.1.0.0.nupkg to 'http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package'...
info :   PUT http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package/
info : An error was encountered when fetching 'PUT http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package/'. The request will now be retried.
info : Connection refused
info :   PUT http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package/
info : An error was encountered when fetching 'PUT http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package/'. The request will now be retried.
info : Connection refused
info :   PUT http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package/
error: Connection refused
```
What I do is:
```
dotnet nuget push -s https://my-server.com/v3/index.json -k NUGET-SERVER-API-KEY Package.nupkg
```
I ran container on the server I am pushing to as following:
```
docker run --rm --name nuget-server -p 5555:80 --env-file baget.env -v "$(pwd)/baget-data:/var/baget" loicsharma/baget:latest
```
My index.json looks like this:
```
{"version":"3.0.0","resources":   
 [{"@id":"http://localhost:5555/api/v2/package","@type":"PackagePublish/2.0.0","comment":""}, 
 {"@id":"http://localhost:5555/api/v2/symbol","@type":"SymbolPackagePublish/4.9.0","comment":""},

And I can also reach the server and see UI of BaGet.
Can you please help me with that?  What did I miss?  
P.S. Providing wrong api key has the same effect, I see the same error.

title: Support version autocomplete
body:
# Work

* [x] Database support https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/pull/576
* [ ] Azure Search support
* [ ] Azure Tables support

# Background

Implement this protocol: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/api/search-autocomplete-service-resource#enumerate-package-versions

Here's an example from nuget.org: https://azuresearch-usnc.nuget.org/autocomplete?id=newtonsoft.json&prerelease=true&semVerLevel=2.0.0

You can find places that need to be updated here: https://github.com/loic-sharma/BaGet/search?q=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Floic-sharma%2FBaGet%2Fissues%2F291&unscoped_q=https%3A%2F%2Fgithub.com%2Floic-sharma%2FBaGet%2Fissues%2F291

title: Add regex appsettings to control deletion and overwriting behavior
body:
The following 2 appsettings have been added and implemented:
- DeleteMatch: Takes a regex as value. Only packages matching this regex (format: {id} {version}) can be unlisted or deleted (depending on the PackageDeletionBehavior). The default value (.*) matches anything.
- OverwriteMatch: Takes a regex as value. Only packages matching this regex (format: {id} {version}) can be overwritten. This condition will only be evaluated when the AllowPackageOverwrites is set to true . The default value (.*) matches anything.

title: Make listen port configurable from config
body: Make listen port/urls configurable from config

title: Add multiply mirroring support
body: Add multiply mirroring support

title: Provide the option to get DB connection string from ENV variable.
body:
Summary of the changes (in less than 80 chars)

 * Add the option to specify connection string via environment variable
 * Allows docker containers to resolve secrets at run time rather than hard code them into connection strings withing the application. 
* This is a quick solution, a better solution would be to provide a generic platform agnostic way of accessing secrets at run time then building the connection string within the application itself.  

(Not sure why my old commits are shown here as well, those are already merged)

title: Upload page incorrectly lists the NuGet command as: 'nuget -Source ${…
body:
Upload page incorrectly lists the NuGet command as:
  'nuget -Source ${this.serviceIndexUrl} package.nupkg'

This should be:
  'nuget push -Source ${this.serviceIndexUrl} package.nupkg'

title: Too many database connections are opened to baget database
body:
Why there are so many connection are opened if nobody download any packages at this  time?


### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Using this version of BaGet in docker 'baget:873b133c619e2bc048bbedc5a7fa8007c688eaf8'
2. Using PostgreSQL
3. See active connections and filter it for baget datase:

```
SELECT * FROM pg_stat_activity
where datname = 'baget_packages'
```

4. This query exec too many time:
```
SELECT p."Key", p."Authors", p."Description", p."Downloads", p."HasReadme", p."IconUrl", p."Id", p."IsPrerelease", p."Language", p."LicenseUrl", p."Listed", p."MinClientVersion", p."ProjectUrl", p."Published", p."RepositoryType", p."RepositoryUrl", p."RequireLicenseAcceptance", p."RowVersion", p."SemVerLevel", p."Summary", p."Tags", p."Title", p."Version"
FROM "Packages" AS p
WHERE (p."Id" = $1) AND (p."Listed" = TRUE)
ORDER BY p."Key"

```
### Screenshots
![Screenshot_1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9221694/59193292-e62eff00-8b8d-11e9-81e3-8e83b782828b.png)


The source code seems to be ok. Could you please clarify what is the problem?

title: Bump handlebars from 4.0.12 to 4.1.2 in /src/BaGet.UI
body:
Bumps [handlebars](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js) from 4.0.12 to 4.1.2.
Changelog *Sourced from [handlebars's changelog](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/blob/master/release-notes.md).* > ## v4.1.2 - April 13th, 2019 > Chore/Test: > - [#1515](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wycats/handlebars.js/pull/1515) - Port over linting and test for typings ([@​zimmi88](https://api.github.com/users/zimmi88)) > - chore: add missing typescript dependency, add package-lock.json - 594f1e3 > - test: remove safari from saucelabs - 871accc > > Bugfixes: > - fix: prevent RCE through the "lookup"-helper - cd38583 > > Compatibility notes: > > Access to the constructor of a class thought `{{lookup obj "constructor" }}` is now prohibited. This closes > a leak that only half closed in versions 4.0.13 and 4.1.0, but it is a slight incompatibility. > > This kind of access is not the intended use of Handlebars and leads to the vulnerability described > in [#1495](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wycats/handlebars.js/issues/1495). We will **not** increase the major version, because such use is not intended or documented, > and because of the potential impact of the issue (we fear that most people won't use a new major version > and the issue may not be resolved on many systems). > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.1.1...v4.1.2) > > ## v4.1.1 - March 16th, 2019 > Bugfixes: > - fix: add "runtime.d.ts" to allow "require('handlebars/runtime')" in TypeScript - 5cedd62 > > Refactorings: > - replace "async" with "neo-async" - 048f2ce > - use "substring"-function instead of "substr" - 445ae12 > > Compatibility notes: > - This is a bugfix release. There are no breaking change and no new features. > > > [Commits](https://github.com/wycats/handlebars.js/compare/v4.1.0...v4.1.1) > > ## v4.1.0 - February 7th, 2019 > New Features > > - import TypeScript typings - 27ac1ee > > Security fixes: > > - disallow access to the constructor in templates to prevent RCE - 42841c4, [#1495](https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/wycats/handlebars.js/issues/1495) > > Housekeeping > > - chore: fix components/handlebars package.json and auto-update on release - bacd473 > - chore: Use node 10 to build handlebars - 78dd89c > - chore/doc: Add more release docs - 6b87c21 > > ... (truncated)

title: Cannot push nuget packages to BaGet behind an  IIS Reverse Proxy
body:
### Describe the bug
I'm using BaGet inside a windows docker image. IIS 10 is used as a reverse proxy. 
This is the web.config file used to proxy queries with the pattern domain.de/nuget/ to the BaGet server which is running in a Windows Docher container on another machine with the IP 192.168.178.2.

```
		 <rule name="nuget" stopProcessing="true">
                    <match url="nuget/(.*)" />
                    <action type="Rewrite" url="http://192.168.178.2:5555/{R:1}" />
                    <serverVariables>
                        <set name="HTTP_FORWARDED" value="for={REMOTE_ADDR};by={LOCAL_ADDR};host="{HTTP_HOST}";proto="https"" />
			<set name="HTTP_X_FORWARDED_HOST" value="{HTTP_HOST}" />
			<set name="HTTP_X_FORWARDED_SCHEMA" value="https" />
			<set name="HTTP_X_FORWARDED_PROTO" value="https" />
                    </serverVariables>
                </rule>
````
This is my baget.env :
```				
ApiKey=NUGET-SERVER-API-KEY
PathBase=/nuget
Storage__Type=FileSystem
Storage__Path=c:\packages
Database__Type=Sqlite
Database__ConnectionString=Data Source=C:\packages\baget.db
Search__Type=Database
```

When Im running however the nuget push command it uses the internal IP address (the url of docker container) and not the one of the proxy.
```
$ dotnet nuget push  -s https://proxydomain.de/nuget/v3/index.json -k NUGET-SERVER-API-KEY package.nupkg
info : Pushing package.nupkg to 'https://192.168.178.2:5555/api/v2/package'...
info :   PUT https://192.168.178.2:5555/api/v2/package/
info : An error was encountered when fetching 'PUT https://192.168.178.2:5555/api/v2/package/'. The request will now be retried.
info : A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond
info :   PUT https://192.168.178.2:5555/api/v2/package/
info : An error was encountered when fetching 'PUT https://192.168.178.2:5555/api/v2/package/'. The request will now be retried.
info : A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond
info :   PUT https://192.168.178.2:5555/api/v2/package/
error: A connection attempt failed because the connected party did not properly respond after a period of time, or established connection failed because connected host has failed to respond
```

The angular UI isnt running at all. Thats seems to be however the typical problem with the base element not set correctly.

title: Bump bootstrap from 3.3.7 to 3.4.1 in /src/BaGet.UI
body:
Bumps [bootstrap](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap) from 3.3.7 to 3.4.1.
Release notes *Sourced from [bootstrap's releases](https://github.com/twbs/bootstrap/releases).* > ## v3.4.1 > * **Security:** Fixed an XSS vulnerability (CVE-2019-8331) in our tooltip and popover plugins by implementing a new HTML sanitizer > * Handle bad selectors (`#`) in `data-target` for Dropdowns > * Clarified tooltip selector documentation > * Added support for NuGet contentFiles > > ## v3.4.0 > - **New:** Added a `.row-no-gutters` class. > - **New:** Added docs searching via Algolia. > - **Fixed:** Resolved an XSS issue in Alert, Carousel, Collapse, Dropdown, Modal, and Tab components. See for details. > - **Fixed:** Added padding to `.navbar-fixed-*` on modal open > - **Fixed:** Removed the double border on `` elements. > - Removed Gist creation in web-based Customizer since anonymous gists were disabled long ago by GitHub. > - Removed drag and drop support from Customizer since it didn't work anymore. > - Added a dropdown to the docs nav for newer and previous versions. > - Update the docs to use a new `baseurl`, `/docs/3.4/`, to version the v3.x documentation like we do with v4. > - Reorganized the v3 docs CSS to use Less. > - Switched to BrowserStack for tests. > - Updated links to always use https and fix broken URLs. > - Replaced ZeroClipboard with clipboard.js

title: Database: Tags in Packages is to short
body:
### Describe the bug
Publishing a Powershell Module with many Commands Fail

### To Reproduce
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
Run BaGet 'v0.1.77-prerelease' in Azure AppService connected to an Blob Storage and Azure SQL Database.
Run these PowerShell
```
$AppName = 'MyBaGet'
Register-PSRepository -Name "BaGet" -SourceLocation "http://$AppName.azurewebsites.net/v3/index.json" -PublishLocation "http://$AppName.azurewebsites.net/api/v2/package" -InstallationPolicy "Trusted"
